customer_reviews.title: Never turned on

But this rechargeable battery never worked. I have tried regular battery it worked, but even after charging the Petzl battery pack, it did not turn on. I tried to fix it but it was on the plastic level that the connection was loose and did not make contact with the battery pins. I have returned the item and I actually don't know which headlamp I am going to buy next.. Any advices?

customer_reviews.title: Solid headlamp
customer_reviews.text: The headlamp works great and is of good quality. The 3 brightness levels for the white light setting is adequate, I will not need infinite dimming levels like the BlackDiamond Revolt. The only con with this headlamp is the angle of tilt, it is designed to look more upwards than downwards. So when doing close up work, the light beam focuses more forward. Having one more click downward would have been very useful for reading. A blinking white light would be handy but not necessary. There is a blinking red light. The Core rechargeable battery lasts a long time and uses standard USB cables for charging. The lamp is water resistant and has a beautiful design.

customer_reviews.title: Great headlamp!
customer_reviews.text: Quick pre-field-test review; I'll update once I've actually gone camping. Based on the backyard test, it has impressive field of vision, brightness and distance (depending on mode of course) and the red modes while pretty dim will probably work great in the really low-light conditions when you'd use them. Lightweight but still sturdily-built. Rechargeable battery with AAA backup is a great feature. The whistle is loud, and it's nice to keep these two essentials together. It's not cheap to be sure, but it's a heck of a light.

customer_reviews.title: Great light, but don't get it wet.

The rechargeable battery is sweet, especially since you can now recharge your light while driving in a car. I'd have rated this 5 stars but when you close the case there is a very visible gap that leads right into the battery compartment. This gives me doubts that I would trust this light to being put to any serious use.

I actually found another use: using the red light to do some work in the motel room after my husband went to sleep, so as not to disturb him. Anyhow, once I figured out how to open it up and plug in the little USB cord to charge it, it was easy to use and seems to securely fit my big head. ;-) It's small enough to fit in my camera bag, too.

customer_reviews.title: Questionable weather resistance

Rated as IPX4 (weather resistant). I have my doubts, see the pictures. There's an open seam that would easily let splashing water (the IPX4 standard) enter the device. I find it improbable it would not short out. Still, for dry conditions it will be ok for purpose.

customer_reviews.text: Great product, super bright. Just what i expected. Closing in the battery housing doesn't seem perfect, and plastic round that area is kind of fragile compared to other headlamps i had .

product_meta.title: PETZL - ACTIK CORE Headlamp
feature_bullets: HAVE A LIT ADVENTURE: The powerful and lightweight ACTIK CORE is built for mountaineering, running, cycling, hiking, and backpacking.
BRILLIANT BEAMS: Features two beam patterns (wide and mixed) to meet your need for high-performance lighting for outdoor activities.
TURN YOUR BRIGHTS DOWN: The red lighting preserves night vision and prevents blinding other members of the group.
NEVER GET CAUGHT IN THE DARK: Featuring a max autonomy burn time of 160 hours and a max power of 350 lumens.
GET RECHARGED: Every ACTIK CORE comes with a CORE rechargeable battery that charges via micro USB port, and is also compatible with AAA batteries.
